lines.content: * Entry point of the Boyd application.
* This class wires together the {@link Storage} (persistence),
* and {@link Ui} (console I/O). It is responsible for bootstrapping the app,
* running the read–eval–print loop, and shutting down cleanly.
private static final Storage STORAGE = new Storage();
private final Ui ui = new Ui();
* @param args command-line arguments (ignored). The app loads from
* Constructs the Boyd app and initializes the task list from disk.
* If loading fails (e.g., file missing or corrupted), the app
* starts with an empty task list and continues to run.
* @param filePath path to the save file (e.g., {@code ./data/boyd.txt})

*
  • Exits when the parser indicates a {@code bye} command.
* Any {@link BoydException} thrown by parsing/commands is caught and rendered
* as a friendly error message via {@link Ui}.
// try-with-resources ensures Scanner is closed (standard: manage resources)

* Creates a new exception with a user-friendly message.
* @param message the error message to display

* Accepts either a date-only string (defaults to 00:00)
* or a date + time pair and formats as "uuuu-MM-dd HH:mm".

* Represents an event task with a start and end time.
* The times are stored as strings (e.g., "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm").
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {
* Base class for all tasks in the Boyd app.
* A task has a textual {@code description} and a completion flag {@code isDone}.
* Subclasses (e.g., {@link ToDo}, {@link Deadline}, {@link Event}) add any
* extra metadata and define their own persistence format via {@link #toDataString()}.
* Creates a new task with the given description, initially not done.
* Returns the single-character status icon used in list displays.
* @return {@code "X"} if done; otherwise a single space
* Marks this task as not done.

*

Keep or remove depending on whether your CLI supports "unmark".
* Returns the user-facing representation, e.g. {@code "[X] read book"}.
* @return display string combining status icon and description
* Serializes this task to the on-disk format used by {@code Storage}.
* Each subclass defines its own layout, e.g.:
* Represents a simple to-do task without any date/time.
* Creates a new {@code ToDo} with the given description.
* Parses user input strings into commands for the Boyd CLI and applies them to a {@link TaskList}.
* Handles a single line of user input by either mutating/printing from the given {@link TaskList}
* @param input the raw user input line
* @param tasks the task list to operate on
* @return {@code true} if the caller should exit (i.e., user typed {@code bye}); {@code false} otherwise
* @throws BoydException for unknown commands or invalid arguments
public static boolean handle(String input, TaskList tasks) {
throw new BoydException("Command cannot be empty.");
// otherwise treat as an "add task" command
* Parses a 1-based index from commands of the form {@code "<cmd> <number>"}.
* @param cmd  the command keyword (e.g., {@code "mark"} or {@code "delete"}) used for error messages
* @throws BoydException if the number is missing or not a valid integer
private static int parseIndex(String line, String cmd) {
throw new BoydException("Command should be: \"" + cmd + " <number>\"");
// Ensure the first token is exactly the command (avoid "market 1" being treated as "mark 1")
throw new BoydException("You must enter a valid number after '" + cmd + "'.");
* Parses an "add task" command into a concrete {@link Task}.
* @param input the full user command (not trimmed further than leading/trailing spaces)
* @return a newly constructed {@link ToDo}, {@link Deadline}, or {@link Event}
* @throws BoydException if the command keyword is unknown, required parts are missing,
throw new BoydException("The description of a todo cannot be empty!");
throw new BoydException("The description of a deadline cannot be empty!");
throw new BoydException("Deadline must have a description and a '/by' date.");
return new Deadline(desc, dateTimeChunks[0], dateTimeChunks[1]); // yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm
return new Deadline(desc, by); // yyyy-MM-dd (defaults to 00:00)
throw new BoydException("Datetime format must be: yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm or yyyy-MM-dd.");
throw new BoydException("The description of an event cannot be empty!");
throw new BoydException("Event must have a description and a '/from' time.");
throw new BoydException("Event must have both a '/from' and a '/to' time.");
return new Event(eventDesc, from, to); // let Event validate/parse

* Loads and saves {@link Task} data to a simple line-based text file.
* Fields are separated by a pipe character {@code |} with optional surrounding spaces.

*
  • Whitespace around the {@code |} separators is ignored when parsing.

*
  • Saving overwrites the whole file each time (no append).

*
  • If the file does not exist on load, an empty list is returned.
* Reads tasks from the given file path.

*

If the file does not exist, an empty list is returned. Blank lines are ignored.
* Any malformed line results in a {@link RuntimeException}.
* @param filePath path to the text file (e.g., {@code ./data/boyd.txt})
* @return list of tasks reconstructed from the file; never {@code null}
* Saves all tasks to {@code ./data/boyd.txt}, creating the {@code ./data} folder if needed.

*

Each task is written via {@link Task#toDataString()} followed by the platform
* line separator. The file is overwritten on each call.
public void save(List<? extends Task> tasks) {
* Parses one stored line into a {@link Task}.
throw new RuntimeException("Empty line in save file");
throw new RuntimeException("Bad line (need at least 3 fields): " + line);
throw new RuntimeException("Deadline missing due date: " + line);
throw new RuntimeException("Event missing start/end: " + line);
// Split on " - " (with spaces) so we don't break on date hyphens.
throw new RuntimeException("Event start/end should be 'from - to': " + line);
throw new RuntimeException("Unknown task type '" + type + "' in line: " + line);
* Parses the done flag from the file format.
* @param s {@code "0"} for not done, {@code "1"} for done (whitespace allowed)
* @return {@code true} if done, {@code false} if not done
* @throws RuntimeException if the flag is not {@code "0"} or {@code "1"}
throw new RuntimeException("Done flag must be 0 or 1, got: " + s);
* Mutable, in-memory list of {@link Task} items with simple persistence and UI output.
* This class manages tasks, prints user-facing messages via {@link Ui}, and
* persists changes via {@link Storage} when available.
* Indices passed to mutating methods are 1-based (as shown to users).
* @implNote All methods that change the list call {@link #persist()} which is a no-op if
* {@link Storage} is {@code null}. User-visible messages are printed inside this class.
private final Ui ui = new Ui();
* Creates a {@code TaskList} initialized from an existing list.
* The provided list is copied defensively.
* @param storage  persistence provider; may be {@code null} for in-memory only
public TaskList(List<? extends Task> taskList, Storage storage) {

* Returns the number of tasks currently stored.
* Console UI helper for the Boyd chatbot.
* Provides convenience methods to print a consistent separator line,
* standard greetings/farewells, and framed messages to {@link System#out}.
/** Horizontal separator used to frame console output blocks. */
* Prints the horizontal separator line followed by a newline.
* Prints a standard greeting that includes the chatbot name and a prompt,
* framed above and below by the separator line.
System.out.println("What can I do for you?");
* Prints a standard farewell message framed by the separator line.
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");

* Prints an arbitrary message framed by the separator line.
